intro: Angostura tapajozensis, commonly known as the Tapajóns angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
